newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland to privatise Kopex trader in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Poland to privatise Kopex trader in 1997.

text.p: The Polish treasury ministry will float 25 percent of shares of mining machinery trader Kopex SA this year and sell a 34-percent stake in the firm to large investors, probably by July, the firm's president said.
"Twenty five percent of Kopex, fully owned by the treasury, will be sold in a public offer...by the end of this year," the Parkiet business daily quoted Eugeniusz Kuczka as saying.
Kuczka was quoted as saying that 14 foreign and Polish buyers were interested in the 34-percent stake earmarked for institutional investors.
Parkiet reported that Kopex employees would be offered 15 percent of the company's shares while the treasury would keep a 26-percent stake.
Kopex has a turnover of about $100 million in 1995. No other financial data were immediately available.
